questions.question: What is the purpose of a facial close up?

choices.answer: To show a connection to the character
To establish a clear image of the character's appearance
To highlight the character's facial shape
To focus on a specific detail

questions.question: What effect can lighting have on a film?

choices.answer: To make the characters stand out
To shock the audience
Establish the mood, tone and atmosphere
To define the genre

questions.question: What type of shot is this?

choices.answer: Extreme long shot
Low angle shot
Mid shot
Establishing shot

questions.question: What is the effect of a high angle shot?

choices.answer: To make the subject appear weak and insignificant
To highlight a dramatic plot twist
Reveal a power struggle
Make the subject appear strong and in control
Sounds that are not visible on screen
Visible background sounds

questions.question: What shot is this an example of?

choices.answer: Ariel shot
Dutch tilt shot
Panning shot
High angle shot

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Point of View (POV) shot?

choices.answer: To create action and excitment
To make the subject appear powerful
To include and involve the audience

questions.question: What is the mise en scene?

choices.answer: The lighting and mood of the scene
The atmosphere created by characters
The purposeful arrangement of all film elements in a scene
A combination of lighting and colour in the scene
An action or object which has a deeper meaning in the plot
An action of object which foreshadows a later event
Reaction shots revealed by characters
Something insignificant which turns out to be useful later
An important object
A series of short shots used to create a mood
Music overlayed in a scene
A journey experienced by a character

questions.question: What is indirect questioning in a documentary?

choices.answer: Audience hear the interviewer's questions
Audience do not hear the interviewer's questions

questions.question: What is the term for an unseen voice explaining the scene or film?

choices.answer: Voice over narration
Direct narration
